description.narrative: The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to support the social and economic reintegration of demobilized ex-combatants and improve access to socio-economic infrastructure and economic opportunities for host communities.

condition.narrative: Section I C.2: The Recipient shall furnish to the Association, not later than November 30 of each year, the annual work plans andbudgets approved by the Strategic Committee for the Association’s review and approval; except for the annual work plan and budgetfor the Project for the first year of Project implementation, which shall be furnished no later than one (1) month after theEffective Date.

Section I E.4: The Recipient shall not later than four (4) months after the Effective Date, prepare and adopt the ESMF, as providedfor by the ESSAP, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, and shall ensure that it is consulted upon with affectedcommunities and disclosed in the territory of the Recipient and at the Bank’s InfoShop.

Section I E.5: The Recipient shall, not later than four (4) months after the Effective Date, prepare and adopt the RPF in form andsubstance satisfactory to the Association and shall ensure that it is consulted upon with affected communities and disclosed in theterritory of the Recipient and at the Bank’s InfoShop.
Section II B.4: Not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, the Recipient shall recruit a procurement officer, an FMofficer, and an administrative and financial assistant.

title.narrative: Percentage of ex-combatants who received, from those who requested, additional drop-in reintegration support
Percentage of identified eligible former combatants who received specialized support
Percentage of demobilized ex-combatants availing income generation opportunities (disaggregated by age, sex, and type of economic activity)
Number of host communities (local committees/community councils) members trained in conflict mediation, social cohesion and technical aspects related to the maintenance of infrastructures
Percentage of ex-combatants who are satisfied with the start-up reintegration support
Percentage of targeted former combatants reporting satisfaction with services provided by this program
Percentage of ex-combatants who successfully completed orientation, counseling and skills training
Number of beneficiaries in target communities with improved access to socioeconomic infrastructure (disaggregated by sex)
Number of members of host communities, including at-risk and vulnerable peoples, employed and paid by the project (disaggregated byage and sex)
Number of planned small-scale socioeconomic infrastructure sub-projects successfully completed (construction or rehabilitation)
Number ex-combatants who received reintegration start-up support
Number of demobilized ex-combatants who have undergone socioeconomic reintegration (disaggregated by age, sex and armed group affiliation)
Number of host community members participating in community-based decision making/participatory planning exercises
Number of host community members participating in capacity building activities
Percentage of total project beneficiaries who report acceptance to return of demobilized ex-combatants (disaggregated by returnees vis-a-vis local communities)
Percentage of host community members who report social acceptance of ex-combatants (disaggregated by age and sex)
Percentage of total beneficiaries in local communities reporting higher security and reconciliation (disaggregated by age, sex and armed groups affiliation)
Number of host community members, including at-risk/vulnerable peoples, who completed skills training related to the construction, rehabilitation and maintenance of infrastructures
Number of ex-combatants who were received by the PREC for vocational trainings as part of the socio-economic reintegration package
Number of youth-at-risk who received basic and vocational trainings
